content: The "Senior Investor Protections Enhancement Act of 2009" is the short title of this Act. It includes definitions for various terms used in the Act. The "Senior Investor Protections Enhancement Act of 2009" defines key terms such as "senior" as an individual aged 62 or older and "securities laws" as specific acts related to securities regulation. The Act amends sections of the Securities Act of 1933 and the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to include the definition of "senior." The Securities Exchange Act of 1934, Investment Company Act of 1940, and Investment Advisers Act of 1940 have been amended to define "senior" as an individual aged 62 or older.
